thread.title: Foothill tennis roundup: West Ranch routs Cents
thread.title_full: Foothill tennis roundup: West Ranch routs Cents

author: Mason Nesbitt
title: Foothill tennis roundup: West Ranch routs Cents
text:
Foothill tennis roundup: West Ranch routs Cents Hart, Valencia win big, too Posted: October 1, 2015 10:06 p.m. Updated: October 1, 2015 10:06 p.m. 
West Ranch’s Olivia Bloome and Brittany Waugh won Thursday’s rematch of the recent Fall Brawl doubles final over Saugus’ Carlie Ozaki and Megan Cho in a hard-fought tiebreaker. 
The match as a whole wasn’t nearly as close. 
The Wildcats topped the Centurions 16-2 at Saugus High, sweeping singles and rolling toward a Valencia rematch loaded with Foothill League title implications. 
“The focus was we wanted a tough match today,” said West Ranch head coach Dina McBride. “I wanted them to be prepared to be in tough situations for Valencia.” 
The Wildcats doubles teams found that challenge in Ozaki and Cho, who pushed Bloome and Waugh to the brink. 
Bloome and Waugh still haven’t lost a set in league play, but they needed a 7-6 (7-4) tie break win to get past the team they defeated in the Fall Brawl title match on Saturday. 
West Ranch’s No. 1 doubles team won its two other sets 6-0, 6-0. 
“We feel pretty confident. I think it’s because we have that experience playing together,” said Bloome, who transferred to West Ranch (6-2 overall, 3-1 in Foothill) from Oaks Christian before this season, but played in several USTA tournaments with Waugh before school started. 
Cho and Ozaki beat the Wildcats’ No. 3 team 6-0 and then played the match of the day in round three, a 7-6 (7-1) tie break win over West Ranch No. 2 Cori Raffish and Audrey Kim. 
“They are the best one-two punch in our league,” Saugus head coach Ken Jeffris said of West Ranch’s Nos. 1 and 2 doubles teams. 
Wildcat Quinterra Walter-Eze swept three sets 6-0, 6-1, 6-0, while her teammates Yasmine Chinda and Emily Andrews won two sets each before being subbed out. 
Saugus is 6-5 overall and 1-3 in league. 
West Ranch plays Golden Valley next Wednesday before hosting Valencia — which beat the Wildcats 13-5 to open the league season — next Thursday. 
Valencia 14, Canyon 4 
The defending Foothill League champs kept rolling along on Thursday. 
The Vikings (9-2, 4-0) won eight doubles sets and had their way in singles — except against Katrina DeGuzman. 
The Canyon senior won her three sets 6-1, 6-4, 6-2 against a lineup consisting of some of the league’s best singles players: Kate Zeile, Amanda Tabanera and Jennifer Shin. 
Valencia’s Lauren Wolf won three doubles sets, two with Gianna Benitez. While Lindsey Gollom and Ahanti Bommireddipalli won three sets 7-5, 6-0, 6-0. 
Canyon falls to 1-3 in league and 5-5 overall with the loss. 
Hart 16, Golden Valley 2 
It was a good day all around for the Indians. 
Hart (6-5, 3-1) swept in singles, led by Natalia Munoz’s three-set sweep. She didn’t drop a single game. 
Teammates Nicole Alvarez and Zobia Quaraishi both swept in singles, too. 
As did Hart’s No. 1 doubles team of Cassidy Wilkinson and Abby Morris. They lost only one game. 
Monica Folgar and Marissa Wamboldt teamed up for three wins, as well. 
The doubles team of Amber King and Giselle Zendejas and the pairing of Abigail Yang and Jzan Villanos each won a set for Golden Valley (1-9, 0-4).
